extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.mongodb.DeleteMongo
extension.description: Executes a delete query against a MongoDB collection. The query is provided in the body of the flowfile and the user can select whether it will delete one or many documents that match it.

property.name: mongo-client-service
property.description: If configured, this property will use the assigned client service for connection pooling.

property.name: Mongo Database Name
property.description: The name of the database to use

property.name: Mongo Collection Name
property.description: The name of the collection to use

property.name: delete-mongo-delete-mode
property.description: Choose between deleting one document by query or many documents by query.

allowableValue.description: Delete only the first document that matches the query.
Delete every document that matches the query.
Read the 'mongodb.delete.mode attribute and use that mode. Acceptable values are 'many' and 'one.'

property.name: delete-mongo-fail-on-no-delete
property.description: Determines whether to send the flowfile to the success or failure relationship if nothing is successfully deleted.

allowableValue.description: Fail when no documents are deleted.
Do not fail when nothing is deleted.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are written to MongoDB are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be written to MongoDB are routed to this relationship

readsAttribute.name: mongodb.delete.mode
readsAttribute.description: Configurable parameter for controlling delete mode on a per-flowfile basis. The process must be configured to use this option. Acceptable values are 'one' and 'many.'

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.mongodb.GetMongo
extension.description: Creates FlowFiles from documents in MongoDB loaded by a user-specified query.

property.name: mongo-client-service
property.description: If configured, this property will use the assigned client service for connection pooling.

property.name: Mongo Database Name
property.description: The name of the database to use

property.name: Mongo Collection Name
property.description: The name of the collection to use

property.name: json-type
property.description: By default, MongoDB's Java driver returns "extended JSON". Some of the features of this variant of JSON may cause problems for other JSON parsers that expect only standard JSON types and conventions. This configuration setting controls whether to use extended JSON or provide a clean view that conforms to standard JSON.

allowableValue.description: Use MongoDB's "extended JSON". This is the JSON generated with toJson() on a MongoDB Document from the Java driver
Generate a JSON document that conforms to typical JSON conventions instead of Mongo-specific conventions.

property.name: use-pretty-printing
property.description: Choose whether or not to pretty print the JSON from the results of the query. Choosing 'True' can greatly increase the space requirements on disk depending on the complexity of the JSON document

property.name: mongo-charset
property.description: Specifies the character set of the document data.

property.name: Query
property.description: The selection criteria to do the lookup. If the field is left blank, it will look for input from an incoming connection from another processor to provide the query as a valid JSON document inside of the FlowFile's body. If this field is left blank and a timer is enabled instead of an incoming connection, that will result in a full collection fetch using a "{}" query.

property.name: mongo-query-attribute
property.description: If set, the query will be written to a specified attribute on the output flowfiles.

property.name: Projection
property.description: The fields to be returned from the documents in the result set; must be a valid BSON document

property.name: Sort
property.description: The fields by which to sort; must be a valid BSON document

property.name: Limit
property.description: The maximum number of elements to return

property.name: Batch Size
property.description: The number of elements to be returned from the server in one batch

property.name: results-per-flowfile
property.description: How many results to put into a FlowFile at once. The whole body will be treated as a JSON array of results.

property.name: mongo-date-format
property.description: The date format string to use for formatting Date fields that are returned from Mongo. It is only applied when the JSON output format is set to Standard JSON. Full documentation for format characters can be found here: https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html

property.name: get-mongo-send-empty
property.description: If a query executes successfully, but returns no results, send an empty JSON document signifying no result.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that have the results of a successful query execution go here.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All input FlowFiles that are part of a failed query execution go here.

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: All input FlowFiles that are part of a successful query execution go here.

writesAttribute.name: mongo.database.name
writesAttribute.description: The database where the results came from.

writesAttribute.name: mongo.collection.name
writesAttribute.description: The collection where the results came from.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.mongodb.GetMongoRecord
extension.description: A record-based version of GetMongo that uses the Record writers to write the MongoDB result set.

property.name: mongo-client-service
property.description: If configured, this property will use the assigned client service for connection pooling.

property.name: get-mongo-record-writer-factory
property.description: The record writer to use to write the result sets.

property.name: Mongo Database Name
property.description: The name of the database to use

property.name: Mongo Collection Name
property.description: The name of the collection to use

property.name: mongodb-schema-name
property.description: The name of the schema in the configured schema registry to use for the query results.

property.name: mongo-query-attribute
property.description: If set, the query will be written to a specified attribute on the output flowfiles.

property.name: Query
property.description: The selection criteria to do the lookup. If the field is left blank, it will look for input from an incoming connection from another processor to provide the query as a valid JSON document inside of the FlowFile's body. If this field is left blank and a timer is enabled instead of an incoming connection, that will result in a full collection fetch using a "{}" query.

property.name: Projection
property.description: The fields to be returned from the documents in the result set; must be a valid BSON document

property.name: Sort
property.description: The fields by which to sort; must be a valid BSON document

property.name: Limit
property.description: The maximum number of elements to return

property.name: Batch Size
property.description: The number of elements to be returned from the server in one batch

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that have the results of a successful query execution go here.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All input FlowFiles that are part of a failed query execution go here.

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: All input FlowFiles that are part of a successful query execution go here.

writesAttribute.name: mongo.database.name
writesAttribute.description: The database where the results came from.

writesAttribute.name: mongo.collection.name
writesAttribute.description: The collection where the results came from.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.mongodb.PutMongo
extension.description: Writes the contents of a FlowFile to MongoDB

property.name: mongo-client-service
property.description: If configured, this property will use the assigned client service for connection pooling.

property.name: Mongo Database Name
property.description: The name of the database to use

property.name: Mongo Collection Name
property.description: The name of the collection to use

property.name: Mode
property.description: Indicates whether the processor should insert or update content

property.name: Upsert
property.description: When true, inserts a document if no document matches the update query criteria; this property is valid only when using update mode, otherwise it is ignored

property.name: Update Query Key
property.description: Key name used to build the update query criteria; this property is valid only when using update mode, otherwise it is ignored. Example: _id

property.name: putmongo-update-query
property.description: Specify a full MongoDB query to be used for the lookup query to do an update/upsert.

property.name: put-mongo-update-mode
property.description: Choose an update mode. You can either supply a JSON document to use as a direct replacement or specify a document that contains update operators like $set, $unset, and $inc. When Operators mode is enabled, the flowfile content is expected to be the operator part for example: {$set:{"key": "value"},$inc:{"count":1234}} and the update query will come from the configured Update Query property.

property.name: Character Set
property.description: The Character Set in which the data is encoded

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are written to MongoDB are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be written to MongoDB are routed to this relationship

systemResourceConsideration.description: An instance of this component can cause high usage of this system resource. Multiple instances or high concurrency settings may result a degradation of performance.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.mongodb.PutMongoRecord
extension.description: This processor is a record-aware processor for inserting/upserting data into MongoDB. It uses a configured record reader and schema to read an incoming record set from the body of a flowfile and then inserts/upserts batches of those records into a configured MongoDB collection. This processor does not support deletes. The number of documents to insert/upsert at a time is controlled by the "Batch Size" configuration property. This value should be set to a reasonable size to ensure that MongoDB is not overloaded with too many operations at once.

property.name: mongo-client-service
property.description: If configured, this property will use the assigned client service for connection pooling.

property.name: Mongo Database Name
property.description: The name of the database to use

property.name: Mongo Collection Name
property.description: The name of the collection to use

property.name: record-reader
property.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for parsing incoming data and determining the data's schema

property.name: insert_count
property.description: The number of records to group together for one single insert/upsert operation against MongoDB.

property.name: ordered
property.description: Perform ordered or unordered operations

property.name: bypass-validation
property.description: Bypass schema validation during insert/upsert

property.name: update-key-fields
property.description: Comma separated list of fields based on which to identify documents that need to be updated. If this property is set NiFi will attempt an upsert operation on all documents. If this property is not set all documents will be inserted.

property.name: update-mode
property.description: Choose between updating a single document or multiple documents per incoming record.

allowableValue.description: Updates only the first document that matches the query.
Updates every document that matches the query.
Use the value of the 'mongodb.update.mode' attribute of the incoming flowfile. Acceptable values are 'one' and 'many'.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are written to MongoDB are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be written to MongoDB are routed to this relationship

readsAttribute.name: mongodb.update.mode
readsAttribute.description: Configurable parameter for controlling update mode on a per-flowfile basis. Acceptable values are 'one' and 'many' and controls whether a single incoming record should update a single or multiple Mongo documents.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.mongodb.RunMongoAggregation
extension.description: A processor that runs an aggregation query whenever a flowfile is received.

property.name: mongo-client-service
property.description: If configured, this property will use the assigned client service for connection pooling.

property.name: Mongo Database Name
property.description: The name of the database to use

property.name: Mongo Collection Name
property.description: The name of the collection to use

property.name: mongo-charset
property.description: Specifies the character set of the document data.

property.name: mongo-agg-query
property.description: The aggregation query to be executed.

property.name: allow-disk-use
property.description: Set this to true to enable writing data to temporary files to prevent exceeding the maximum memory use limit during aggregation pipeline staged when handling large datasets.

property.name: json-type
property.description: By default, MongoDB's Java driver returns "extended JSON". Some of the features of this variant of JSON may cause problems for other JSON parsers that expect only standard JSON types and conventions. This configuration setting controls whether to use extended JSON or provide a clean view that conforms to standard JSON.

allowableValue.description: Use MongoDB's "extended JSON". This is the JSON generated with toJson() on a MongoDB Document from the Java driver
Generate a JSON document that conforms to typical JSON conventions instead of Mongo-specific conventions.

property.name: mongo-query-attribute
property.description: If set, the query will be written to a specified attribute on the output flowfiles.

property.name: Batch Size
property.description: The number of elements returned from the server in one batch.

property.name: results-per-flowfile
property.description: How many results to put into a flowfile at once. The whole body will be treated as a JSON array of results.

property.name: mongo-date-format
property.description: The date format string to use for formatting Date fields that are returned from Mongo. It is only applied when the JSON output format is set to Standard JSON. Full documentation for format characters can be found here: https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html

relationship.name: results
relationship.description: The result set of the aggregation will be sent to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: The input flowfile gets sent to this relationship when the query fails.

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: The input flowfile gets sent to this relationship when the query succeeds.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.mongodb.gridfs.DeleteGridFS
extension.description: Deletes a file from GridFS using a file name or a query.

property.name: gridfs-client-service
property.description: The MongoDB client service to use for database connections.

property.name: gridfs-database-name
property.description: The name of the database to use

property.name: gridfs-bucket-name
property.description: The GridFS bucket where the files will be stored. If left blank, it will use the default value 'fs' that the MongoDB client driver uses.

property.name: gridfs-file-name
property.description: The name of the file in the bucket that is the target of this processor. GridFS file names do not include path information because GridFS does not sort files into folders within a bucket.

property.name: delete-gridfs-query
property.description: A valid MongoDB query to use to find and delete one or more files from GridFS.

property.name: mongo-query-attribute
property.description: If set, the query will be written to a specified attribute on the output flowfiles.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: When the operation succeeds, the flowfile is sent to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: When there is a failure processing the flowfile, it goes to this relationship.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.mongodb.gridfs.FetchGridFS
extension.description: Retrieves one or more files from a GridFS bucket by file name or by a user-defined query.

property.name: gridfs-client-service
property.description: The MongoDB client service to use for database connections.

property.name: gridfs-database-name
property.description: The name of the database to use

property.name: gridfs-bucket-name
property.description: The GridFS bucket where the files will be stored. If left blank, it will use the default value 'fs' that the MongoDB client driver uses.

property.name: gridfs-file-name
property.description: The name of the file in the bucket that is the target of this processor.

property.name: gridfs-query
property.description: A valid MongoDB query to use to fetch one or more files from GridFS.

property.name: mongo-query-attribute
property.description: If set, the query will be written to a specified attribute on the output flowfiles.

property.name: mongo-operation-mode
property.description: This option controls when results are made available to downstream processors. If Stream Query Results is enabled, provenance will not be tracked relative to the input flowfile if an input flowfile is received and starts the query. In Stream Query Results mode errors will be handled by sending a new flowfile with the original content and attributes of the input flowfile to the failure relationship. Streaming should only be used if there is reliable connectivity between MongoDB and NiFi.

allowableValue.description: Fetch the entire query result and then make it available to downstream processors.
As soon as the query start sending results to the downstream processors at regular intervals.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: When the operation succeeds, the flowfile is sent to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: When there is a failure processing the flowfile, it goes to this relationship.

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: The original input flowfile goes to this relationship if the query does not cause an error

writesAttribute.name: gridfs.file.metadata
writesAttribute.description: The custom metadata stored with a file is attached to this property if it exists.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.mongodb.gridfs.PutGridFS
extension.description: Writes a file to a GridFS bucket.

property.name: gridfs-client-service
property.description: The MongoDB client service to use for database connections.

property.name: gridfs-database-name
property.description: The name of the database to use

property.name: gridfs-bucket-name
property.description: The GridFS bucket where the files will be stored. If left blank, it will use the default value 'fs' that the MongoDB client driver uses.

property.name: gridfs-file-name
property.description: The name of the file in the bucket that is the target of this processor. GridFS file names do not include path information because GridFS does not sort files into folders within a bucket.

property.name: putgridfs-properties-prefix
property.description: Attributes that have this prefix will be added to the file stored in GridFS as metadata.

property.name: putgridfs-enforce-uniqueness
property.description: When enabled, this option will ensure that uniqueness is enforced on the bucket. It will do so by creating a MongoDB index that matches your selection. It should ideally be configured once when the bucket is created for the first time because it could take a long time to build on an existing bucket wit a lot of data.

allowableValue.description: Both the filename and hash must be unique.
Only the filename must be unique.
Only the file hash must be unique.

property.name: putgridfs-hash-attribute
property.description: If uniquness enforcement is enabled and the file hash is part of the constraint, this must be set to an attribute that exists on all incoming flowfiles.

property.name: putgridfs-chunk-size
property.description: Controls the maximum size of each chunk of a file uploaded into GridFS.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: When the operation succeeds, the flowfile is sent to this relationship.

relationship.name: duplicate
relationship.description: Flowfiles that fail the duplicate check are sent to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: When there is a failure processing the flowfile, it goes to this relationship.
